etymologies: late 17th century: modern Latin, from Faroese skúvur, from Old Norse skufr (apparently imitative)

definitions: a large brownish predatory seabird related to the gulls, pursuing other birds to make them disgorge fish they have caught.

notes.text: Family Stercorariidae: genera Catharacta (four larger species) and Stercorarius (three smaller species). See also jaeger

shortDefinitions: large brownish predatory seabird related to gulls
